{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Chop 1 small ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"onion","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":".
Rinse the soaked ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"dal","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", add to a pot of water covered with 2cm of water, and bring to a boil.
Add 1 ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"bayleaf","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 1 tbsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"garlic paste","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 1 tbsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"ginger paste","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 3 ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"cardemon pods","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 1/2 tsp salt, and the chopped onion.
Boil for at least 60 minutes on a low boil with the lid on.
By this time there should be no hard black lentils. If there are, continue cooking for another 10-15minutes.
Mash the dal with the back end of a ladle.
Add extra water if needed to ensure it is still liquid.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

When the cumin seeds are popping, add 1 tsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"ginger paste","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 1 tsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"garlic paste","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", the minced onion, and saute until cooked (~2 minutes).

Add 1 tsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"kashmiri chili powder","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", 1 tbsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"koriander powder","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", and 1/4 tsp ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"garam masala","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":".

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Add the tempering in to the dal.
Bring the mixture up to a medium boil for 1 minute.
Mash the dal slightly more if needed.
Turn down the heat down to a very slow simmer.
Add 125 ml ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"milk/cream","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". 
Cook for at least 30 minutes, but preferably 1.5+ hour.
Preheat the oven at 200 degrees for the naan bread.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
